comments.body: I think that more than "or store", you meant "and store".
as far as I can tell from the following description it does one or the other

I see.  You are right in a way.  In the end, I suppose that both 'or' and 'and' are actually correctly in this sentence because of the "if any" (i.e. it always assigns to countval and it always return a value, but sometimes this return value is a null pointer).
